    • Constructor Detail

      • BroadcastGateway

        public BroadcastGateway​(int pDistributorClientAcceptPort,
                        int pBdxGwyAcceptPort,
                        java.lang.String pBdxGwyName,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> pBdxGwyAllowedInboundGateways,
                        java.util.List<BdxGatewayParameterEntry> pBdxGwyOutboundEntries,
                        java.util.List<BdxGwyMulticastGroupParameterEntry> pMcgEntries,
                        int pDistributorLogFlags)
        Constructor for creating and starting a broadcast gateway instance
        Parameters:
        pDistributorClientAcceptPort - , the TCP/IP port on which local distributor application will connect up and advertise the subjects that they subscribe for.
        pBdxGwyAcceptPort - , the TCP/IP port on which the the broadcast gateway will accept inbound connections on from other broadcast gateways acting as clients
        pBdxGwyName - , the application name used when acting as a distributor
        pBdxGwyAllowedInboundGateways - , a list of remote gateways that are allowed to connect to this gateway if being null any gateway is allowed to connect
        pBdxGwyOutboundEntries - , a list of broadcast gateways to which we will try to connect
        pMcgEntries - , the multicast groups that the gateway will listing to and publish data on.
        pDistributorLogFlags - , distributor log flags

      • BroadcastGateway

        public BroadcastGateway​(int pClientAcceptPort,
                        int pBdxGwyAcceptPort,
                        java.lang.String pBdxGwyName,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> pBdxGwyAllowedInboundGateways,
                        java.util.List<BdxGatewayParameterEntry> pBdxGwyOutboundEntries,
                        java.util.List<BdxGwyMulticastGroupParameterEntry> pMcgEntries)
        Constructor for creating and starting a broadcast gateway instance
        Parameters:
        pClientAcceptPort - , the TCP/IP port on which local distributor application will connect up and advertise the subjects that they subscribe for.
        pBdxGwyAcceptPort - , the TCP/IP port on which the the broadcast gateway will accept inbound connections on from other broadcast gateways acting as clients
        pBdxGwyName - , the application name used when acting as a local distributor
        pBdxGwyAllowedInboundGateways - , a list of remote gateways that are allowed to connect to this gateway if being null any gateway is allowed to connect
        pBdxGwyOutboundEntries - , a list of broadcast gateways to which the gateway will try to connect to and act as an client.
        pMcgEntries - , the multicast groups that the gateway will listing to and publish data on.

      • localDistributorUpdate

        public void localDistributorUpdate​(long pMulticastGroupId,
                                   java.lang.String pSubjectName,
                                   byte[] pMessageBytes)
        This method is invoked when a local update has received. The update is propagated connected to remote broadcast gateways. Only updates matching the remote filter are forward (see updateToRemoteBroadcastGateway).
        Specified by:
        localDistributorUpdate in interface BdxGatewayInterface
        Parameters:
        pMulticastGroupId - , the local MCG id on which the update was received
        pSubjectName - , the canonical subject name
        pMessageBytes - , update message payload i.e. serialized.

      • remoteBdxGatewayUpdate

        public void remoteBdxGatewayUpdate​(long pMulticastGroupId,
                                   java.lang.String pSubjectName,
                                   byte[] pMessageBytes)
        This method is invoked when an update from a remote broadcast gateway has been received The update is republished on the corresponding multicast group i.e. same multicast address and port id.
        Specified by:
        remoteBdxGatewayUpdate in interface BdxGatewayInterface

      • validInboundClient

        public boolean validInboundClient​(java.lang.String pRemoteBdxGwyName)
        Description copied from interface: BdxGatewayInterface
        Check what a remote bdx gateway connection is to be accepted or not. Only defined gateways are accepted.
        Specified by:
        validInboundClient in interface BdxGatewayInterface
        Parameters:
        pRemoteBdxGwyName - , bdx gateway "name" of the gateway connecting
        Returns:
        true if the gateway is allowed to connect otherwise false.
